contentrichtext.text: Twelve ships and a [[shore establishment]] of the [[Royal Navy]] have been named '''HMS ''Lizard''''' after [[The Lizard]], a [[peninsula]] in [[Cornwall]]. '''Ships''' *{{HMS|Lizard|1512|6}} was a ship listed between 1512 and 1522. *{{HMS|Lizard|1652|6}} was a 16-gun [[fireship]] [[Cavalier|Royalist]] ship captured by the [[Roundhead|Parliamentarians]] in 1652 and expended in 1666. *{{HMS|Lizard|1673|6}} was a 4-gun [[sloop-of-war|sloop]] launched in 1673 and captured by the Dutch in 1674. *{{HMS|Lizard|1694|6}} was a 24-gun [[sixth rate]] launched in 1694 and wrecked in 1696. *{{HMS|Lizard|1697|6}} was a 24-gun sixth rate launched in 1697 and sold in 1714. *{{HMS|Lizard|1744|6}} was a 14-gun sloop launched in 1744 and wrecked in 1748. *{{HMS|Lizard|1757|6}} was a 28-gun sixth rate launched in 1757, used for harbour service from 1795 and sold in 1828. *{{HMS|Lizard|1782|6}} was the French ''Cerf''-class [[cutter (ship)|cutter]] ''Lézard'' of eighteen 6-pounder guns, built by Jacques and Daniel Denys at Dunkirk and launched on 10 March 1781. She was captured on 2 October 1782 in the roads of the neutral (Danish) port of [[Tharangambadi|Tranquebar]] and taken to Bombay. There she was released back to France in 1783, after she had been present at the [[Battle of Cuddalore (1783)|Battle of Cuddalore]], and re-entered on the lists in January 1784. She was broken up in 1784.<ref>Demerliac (1996), p.88, #584.</ref> *{{HMS|Lizard|1840|6}} was a wooden paddle vessel launched in 1840 and sunk in 1843 in a collision with the French paddle sloop ''Veloce''. *{{HMS|Lizard|1844|6}} was an iron paddle gunboat launched in 1844 and broken up in 1869. *{{HMS|Lizard|1886|6}} was a composite screw gunvessel launched in 1886 and sold in 1905. *{{HMS|Lizard|1911|6}} was an [[Acheron class destroyer|''Acheron''-class]] [[destroyer]] launched in 1911 and sold in 1921. '''Shore establishments''' *{{HMS|Lizard|shore establishment|6}} was a Combined Operations Landing Craft base, at [[Shoreham-by-Sea|Shoreham]], [[West Sussex]], commissioned in 1942 and closed in 1945. ==Citations== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==References== <references/> * {{Colledge}} * Demerliac, Alain (1996) ''La Marine De Louis XVI: Nomenclature Des Navires Français De 1774 À 1792''. (Nice: Éditions OMEGA). ISBN 2-906381-23-3 * Warlow, Brian (2000) ''Shore Establishments of the Royal Navy'' (second edition)(Liskeard: Maritime Books). ISBN 0-907771-73-4. {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lizard, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
